#531: I don't get how so many people post they are sad and suicidal. If you don't like how things are going do something about it. Don't just sit in your room, do extracurricular activities. Go do some community service. Go out Thursday-Saturday nights with some people. Go outside and talk to people. Go to sporting events/tailgates, and talk to people around you. You are in College, just have some fun, do things you normally wouldn't do. Sometimes you have to put yourself out there.

Tbh Miami is not for everyone and that's ok :) I felt that way as a freshmen first semester, but by second semester I found a great group of friends that even 3 years later I am friends with them. Once you find a great group, it gets better!

A lot of people think that at first, but I have met many people at miami that at first glance appear super dooshy or "dumb-slut"ty (just using those words to make the point I try not to use them anymore) but once I got to know them I realized they were literally the farthest thing from that on the inside. Some people I'm sure are legit that way but I think there are more than enough people who just seem that way (could be for a number of reasons) to go around.
I think you may be hanging with the wrong people. Try meeting new people. You may find people you like.

I'm a freshman this year, and I think it's all about the people you get to know. Any college is going to have some problems, but I think the key to having a good college experience is universal: find and make good friends. I have and it's helped make everything easier :)
transferring from Miami was the best decision I've ever made. I'm so much happier at my current school.

Today we received this submission: "Is there a filter on this page or do they just post anything?"

In short, yes, we filter things.  We try to post as much as we can without censoring because we feel that students should have a place they can say what they want to say anonymously without someone telling them they still can't say it here.  However, if a secret is insulting to an individual and names them, we change the name to initials so the person is not identifiable or something of that nature.  If the post is unintelligible, we don't post it.  Generally speaking we try to keep censoring at a minimum but try to keep posts from being directly aimed towards certain individuals if they are of an offensive nature.  Otherwise, generally speaking, you have complete freedom in your posts.  Additionally, if we receive a message from someone who was personally offended by a secret or something, we will remove a post retroactively.  For example, if we receive a message that someone finds the recent influx of sexual assault posts to be personally offensive or perhaps bring up bad memories of their own experiences, we will start posting a "Trigger Warning" on these posts so people are aware beforehand and can avoid reading if they wish.  We welcome your feedback and are trying as much as we can to keep this page as open and censorship-free as possible.

#487: How did this hilarious page turn into a crazy forum about rape and consent?? I'm just trying to read some funny shit chill out ppl

You all need to go read the original post again. Nowhere does it say that the victim is a girl and they never once mention the word rape. The commenters are the ones blowing this way out of proportion.

not to mention the girl didn't accuse anyone of anything, she just gave the facts of what happened and some jerk came on here and said it was her fault. past the "victim blaming", how about when someone is looking for comfort "I don't even know what happened, is this normal", etc., instead of telling someone to 'stop throwing a pity party', you offer them some real help or advice. Or just don't say anything at all. Anyways, as Matteo said you don't need proof to say that someone was raped. You are innocent until guilty as far as the law is concerned, but that's a different matter.

If the facts are as the woman said they are then it is rape. If the man is to be punished in a criminal prosecution his guilt must be proven beyond a reasonable doubt. Until then he is presumed not guilty. You don't need proof to accuse anyone of anything. You need proof, and a lot of it, to convict someone.

What does this accomplish, exactly? It was an anonymous secret about rape. She wasn't openly accusing anyone of anything, so obviously this was something that just happened to her, not something she made up. The secret wasn't "I want to accuse someone of rape who didn't actually rape me!" Seriously, how some people make these leaps in logic is beyond me.

#486: Hey guess what 476: YOU STILL NEED PROOF BEFORE YOU ACCUSE SOMEONE OF RAPE. Duke Lacrosse, Brian Banks, John Fischler, Walter Swift. All are cases where men were falsely accused of rape, crucified in the media, and had their reputations and careers destroyed because of lies (Walter was wrongly in jail for 26 years!). There's so much emphasis on "victim-blaming" but whatever happened to innocent until proven guilty?

#480: Newsflash people: Being blacked out doesn't change you. It's not a jekyll and hyde thing. The things you do while blacked out are the same things you do when drunk. The only problem is you permanently lose all memory of it leading to the misconception that you had "no control." Under the law you are legally responsible for things you do when blacked out. And to appease the radical feminists that patrol this group: yes if you rape someone while blacked out it is still rape. However you still have to prove there was no consent which is difficult if both parties remember nothing.

also "major douche for taking advantage of you". Umm, no. Major douche is too nice. How about RAPIST.

so fucking sick of victim blaming.  It's not a pity party to be upset when someone assaulted you. Willingly playing a drinking game does not mean you consent to sex. Even starting to have sex with someone does not mean you can't revoke that consent later on, in which case the person should stop. While knowing your limits is always a good thing (and something many freshmen/people who just started drinking learn as time goes on), it isn't the responsibility of the victim to "prevent something like this from happening again". How about people just don't have sex with someone who is drunk. PS - according to the law you legitimately can't give consent when "under the influence", so even if she had consented it was still rape. Don't think that's fair? Dont' want to get charged with rape for having sex with someone who seems willing? THEN DON'T HAVE SEX WITH DRUNK PEOPLE. It's that simple.

#446: One night I got very drunk from a game I'm apparently very bad at. Next thing I know I wake up next to someone I know & would have never have agreed to do anything with sober. The situation was definitely wrong and shouldn't have happened. I'm not sure when/how/if/WHY I consented because I completely blacked out. I'm so confused on how I feel because nothing even close has ever happened to me, but I feel mostly guilty. Is this a one night stand? Is it normal? Because it sucks.

#469: To 446. It sucks what happened to you and I hope you're doing ok since the situation occurred. However you willingly played that drinking game which lead to you getting blackout drunk. You have to realize what happened is partly your fault. Don't throw a pity party, use this to grow stronger as a person and next time know your limits better to prevent something like this from happening again. But this is DEFINITELY not all on you. That guy is still a major douche for taking advantage of you.
